intro: Rhynchospora emaciata, commonly known as the slender beak-rush, is a flowering plant in the Cyperaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and small, spike-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows in wet or marshy habitats, often in temperate regions. Its flowers are usually pale green to brown, and it produces small, three-lobed seeds. Rhynchospora emaciata is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in both full sun and partial shade.
